page.title: 12DISUSED RAILWAY LINE
page.content: The NEATH AND BRECON RAILWAY was the successor to the Brecon Forest Tram- road. It was built in the 1860's and commenced operation in 1867. This railway became part of the G.W.R. net- work in 1922 and then British Railways in 1948. This branch line ceased to operate in 1962. Its route lies across the slopes of Fforest Fach on the western side of Cwm Treweren. In places it can be seen quite clearly, but, because most of the bridges have been destroyed it is not possible to follow the old track for any distance. In some places the site of the track has been ploughed and it is hard to imagine where the track crossed some fields.
